records.location_details: A Frontex member apprehended 2 migrants who had crossed a border river. The incident occurred in a river area, beyond the river, where the terrain was not easily accessible by car. The migrants were transported partially outside the vehicle, sometimes standing on the running board, across the riverbed to the main road.
records.where_clear: Border river area, land, where migrants were apprehended after crossing a river.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific country and exact border location are redacted. Described as a 'river area' and 'border'.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 1 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 2 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: A Frontex member was alleged to have endangered two migrants by transporting them partially outside a vehicle after they crossed a border river. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that such an incident likely occurred, putting the migrants' health at risk. A video of the incident was reportedly shared and deleted. Systemic issues regarding reporting, protocols for precautionary measures, and data access were identified.
records.evidence_quote: two migrants were transported (partially) outside the car by a member of Frontex [...] The Office does not know the exact details of the event, which has likely put health of migrants transported at risk.
